information:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Sean O'Malley is the former bantamweight champion. This fight will be his first since undergoing hip surgery in October 2024 following his loss to Dvalishvili. In preparation for the rematch, O'Malley has been sparring with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley has stated he is confident in his skills and expects to be significantly better than he was in the first fight post-surgery.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Dvalishvili defeats O’Malley again, most likely by decision, at UFC 316.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Any of the following: O’Malley wins (KO/TKO, submission, or decision); the bout ends in a draw or no-contest; the fight is canceled or an opponent change occurs; Dvalishvili does not fight at UFC 316.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Dvalishvili defeats O’Malley at UFC 316 by decision or by finish (KO/TKO/submission).
forecast.rationale: Summary of key inputs: The assistant report says Dvalishvili beat O’Malley by unanimous decision in Sept 2024 to win the belt, then defended it vs. Umar Nurmagomedov in Jan 2025. He’s on a 12-fight win streak and is widely praised for cardio and wrestling. Minor finger/toe issues reported in camp but he intends to fight. O’Malley had hip surgery after their first fight; this is his first fight since, and he’s been sparring with Israel Adesanya, claiming significant improvement.   Reasoning: The status quo favors Dvalishvili. He already solved this matchup once, and his relentless pace and wrestling have historically troubled long, strike-first bantamweights. He has recent, elite five-round form (win over Umar), while O’Malley is returning from surgery and a layoff—both mild negatives for immediate performance and cardio in a grappling-heavy fight. Even if O’Malley’s movement improves post-surgery, neutralizing sustained takedown pressure over 25 minutes is a very high bar. I therefore weight the status quo (Merab’s style edge and recent wins) more heavily.   Why not higher: O’Malley’s finishing upside remains real; his height/reach, timing, and counter striking can punish level changes or entries, and a single big moment could swing a 5-round fight. Rematch adjustments could improve his takedown defense and clinch counters. There is also small pre-fight risk (late injury/illness/weight-cut issues) that would resolve to No under this question’s rules, plus small draw/no-contest probabilities.   Why not lower: Dvalishvili’s proven, repeatable path to victory (pressure wrestling, cardio, control) generally travels well to rematches. He has recently demonstrated top-tier form against an elite wrestler/grappler (Umar). O’Malley is coming off surgery and inactivity, which typically depress immediate performance versus the division’s best grinder.   What would move me up: Clear reports of O’Malley struggling at the cut or with lingering hip issues; confirmation that Merab’s camp injuries are truly minor; strong weigh-in/face-off indicators of Merab’s fitness; credible market/analyst movement widening toward Merab.   What would move me down: Credible evidence O’Malley’s hip recovery has materially boosted his mobility/TDD; reports of Merab’s injuries being worse than stated or compromised training; late opponent changes/cancellation risk increasing; sharp market movement toward O’Malley.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Merab Dvalishvili defeat Sean O'Malley at UFC 316?

Question background:
ESPN: [UFC 316: Dvalishvili vs. O'Malley 2](https://www.espn.com/mma/fightcenter/_/id/600053672/league/ufc)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Dvalishvili does not fight anyone at UFC 316 or fights someone else, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Sean O'Malley is the former bantamweight champion. This fight will be his first since undergoing hip surgery in October 2024 following his loss to Dvalishvili. In preparation for the rematch, O'Malley has been sparring with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley has stated he is confident in his skills and expects to be significantly better than he was in the first fight post-surgery.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
